name: Sheraton Vancouver Wall Centre

reviews.text: We had requested a room on a high floor after reading other reviews of this hotel, upon check in we were told we had the choice of several rooms but if we didn't mind waiting 30 minutes that a room on the Eighteenth floor could be prepared, we were happy to do this and they managed a Twentieth floor room in the North tower. The room was furnished to a high standard in a modern contemporary style and had an incredible panaramic view from the curved glass window which constituted one wall of the room, the bed was possibly the most comfortable I have ever slept in. We ordered room service one evening which was prompt, delicious, good value and combined with the night time view of the city a memorable dining experience. If eating breakfast in the hotel instead of ordering a full breakfast have some eggs with a side order, exactly the same but cheaper. The hotel is in a good location and within easy walking distance of most attractions and shopping areas, some other cheaper hotels are in less salubrious areas.
reviews.title: Room with a view.

reviews.text: Despite what the Vancouver authorities promote, Gas town is not the tourist heaven you would think, Grotty and derelict are two words that spring to mind, put aside a maximum of Five minutes to admire the 1970's built steam clock and then move on to Granville Island. Do also visit the Cappelano suspension bridge and treetop adventure, it's a little expensive but great fun, kids will love it. Five minutes further is the Grouse mountain cable car which again is good fun however if you are touring the Rocky mountains Jasper and Banff both Offer better Cheaper alternatives. We really could not find any fault in the Sheraton wall hotel or the staff. we would definitely use it again.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: i stayed here during the 4th of July weekend in the summer of 2005. this location is great. i left my car parked all weekend. you can walk to everything, Chinatown, Yaletown, the water front. one of the best beds i have ever slept in, oh so cozy. it would also be very nice for business travelers
reviews.title: Nice views - ok rooms

reviews.text: We had a pretty good room, the view was beautiful - we could see english bay, the snow capped mountains and the city christmas lights all from our small room. I think you need to ask, ask and don't forget to ask! - for a higher floor with a view. Yes the rooms are small, but the beds are comfy and the room clean. We didn't try the room service or dining as ofcourse being the sheraton was a tad too expensive for us. Was internet capable, but expensive (again its the sheraton).
reviews.title: More suited to business travellers than leisure

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights on a Virgin Holidays package. Despite Virgin stating the room was 'deluxe' we were allocated a South Tower room on 7th floor which was old fashioned, dated, poky and with no view. The hotel's explanation was that a bog standard room is deemed 'deluxe' so don't be fooled by marketing terms!
reviews.title: I'm getting frustrated with this hotel, yet keep staying here
Solid 3 star
reviews.text: A solid 3 star Sheraton. Stayed for 2 nights in mid-March.

reviews.title: leave your computer at home
reviews.text: Check in was smooth, got an upper floor club level room as requested. The lobby is small & the doors open & close constantly. With the damp weather it made for a spot you definitely wouldn't spend any time in.

The room was fine, comfortable bed & a sitting area divided by a full wall...made for 2 small rooms as opposed to one larger one. Agree with previous posts that internet access was impossible to navigate. Water pressure was great.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Used the gym both mornings...need to arrive right at 6am if you hope to get access to cardio equipment - 6 treadmills, 2 elipticals, 2 bikes & 2 stairmasters. Pool looked ok & weight rooms were separate & not crowded.
reviews.title: hell in vancouver

reviews.text: The restaurant for breakfast is in the North tower, as is the gym. Parking/check in is in the south tower...not the most convenient layout & the restaurant is rather small for a hotel of this size. One morning I waited for 20 minutes in line before going downstairs to Starbucks.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We had a great stay here for our summer vacation. As noted with other reviews, I requested a room on the upper levels. This was done with my tour operator & also by email with the hotel. On arrival we were told that no upper rooms were available. A bit disappointing considering the amount of notice I'd given the hotel but once we were in our room we couldn't complain as the view was of downtown looking towards Stanley Park with the mountains in the background. The room itself was well finished with enough space for a family of four. The leisure club has a good size pool with a couple of hot tubs, steam room, sauna & fitness room. All the usual facilities like towels & lockers are supplied. The hotel is in a great central location in the heart of downtown within easy walking distance of Canada Place, Stanley Park, Granville Island & Kits Beach. It's a short walk to Robson Street with its shops & restaurants. The staff are very friendly & couldn't do enough for us, one of the bar staff was particularly friendly & gave us useful tips on places to visit & places to eat. Bar prices are what you'd expect from a city centre hotel, not bad though. We can't comment on the quality of restaurants apart from breakfast which we only had the once. This was perfectly fine & enjoyed what we had although a little pricey compared to local restaurants. If you're looking for good quality at reasonable prices I'd try out the White Spot, The Red Robin or Milestones, all within a 10 minute walk. Having the two towers is good as there's plenty of space but you feel that the restaurants are spread all over the place, as we didn't use them we can hardly complain. There's a Starbucks in the North Tower, lower level & a 7-11 round the corner. A great way to start your family holiday is to take a limo from the airport, Limo Jet Gold are outside the arrivals terminal & charge $41 to downtown hotels.
reviews.title: Summer vacation

likes.disliked: — Not getting the room we had hoped for

reviews.title: A View of Business Buildings
reviews.text: My husband and I went to a BC Lions game and Canada Place and thought that the Sheraton Vancouver - Wall Centre was a perfect location. It is a perfect location but definitely not all that I had hoped it would be. The view from our room was of business buildings - not the ocean or the mountains as I had thought was implied from a room with a view. The room was small and the cost was well beyond what it should have been. If you're looking to spend this amount of money then I would definitely recommend looking for a different hotel.

I reserved a room(as a SPG member)with a King-Sized Bed but was given a room with two beds. When I phoned down to the reservation desk, the lady told me that there were no more rooms with King sized beds left. It would've been nice to have received an apology up-front instead of having to make a complaint or being 'unpleasantly surprised.' Perhaps they didn't think I would complain? The next day, I was placed in the proper room but it was a hassle having to change rooms.
reviews.title: Given the incorrect room

reviews.text: I probably wouldn't stay there again just because of the experience mentioned above. However, the Hotel Spa was great.
reviews.title: average

reviews.text: My husband and i satyed at the Sheraton from the 25th - 29th June following our alaska cruise. We arrived and were greeted by a porter who took our luggage. we arrived at 9.15am and we werent expecting to be able to check in this early, we just wanted to leave our luggage while we explored the city. The receptioist told us that our room wasnt ready and that we would need to come back at 3pm. we got back at 3 and the room wasnt ready. We went to their bar after a long day and waitied another hour and half before the room was ready. we weren't even often anything to drink for the waiting aound. The room was ok, not worth what we paid for it. We had no problems except when it came to our bill. there was an amount of $39.44 which is not ours and we are still waiting for it to be removed. Apparently this happens quite a lot, i wonder if staff ever ask for evidence that its actually your room they should be charging too or whether a customer can just say any room number and get away with charging it to someone elses room.
reviews.title: Spectacular Hotel. Loved this place.

reviews.text: Stopped here for two nights at the end of May. We had a suite on the 19th floor of the north tower. We would have had wonderful views of the ocean and mountains but for the cloud that seemed to hug the mountains the whole time we were in Vancouver.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
Great Hotel, Great Place to visit
reviews.text: The room was very clean, spacious and modern.
The only slight complaint we had was when we were checking out after picking our hire car up the lady on reception tried to charge us $20 just to park and put our luggage in the car.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: On a recent visit to Vancouver as part of a trip around the West of Canada, myself and my partner had the pleasure of staying at the Sheraton Wall Centre for 4 nights.
reviews.title: Nice view, good location,but room only fair

reviews.text: Without a doubt, this hotel was one of the best hotels we've ever stayed, in fact the Sheraton Group hotels lived upto their name not only here but in Calgary Eau Clair Suites at the end of the trip aswell.
reviews.title: Cinemascope windows in corner suite

aka: Sheraton Vancouver - Wall Centre Hotel Vancouver
description: Whether your visit is for business or for pleasure, you'll feel at home in the Sheraton Vancouver Wall Centre, where you can stroll through the nearby boutiques of Robson Street and Yaletown.
